title: Unionists in Northern Ireland Face Dilemma Over New Trade Deal
description: The Democratic Unionist Party has no legal power to hold up the agreement, which would simplify post-Brexit trade rules. But a rejection could sabotage efforts to restart Northern Ireland’s government.

title: Maurizio Costanzo, Who Transformed Italian Talk Shows, Dies at 84
description: Praised by critics as the inventor of contemporary Italian television, he also used his position to take on the Sicilian Mafia, which tried to kill him.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: Nigeria’s New ‘Big Boss’
description: Also, a major tank battle in Ukraine and a deadly train wreck in Greece.

title: Finland on Cusp of Joining NATO, but Maybe Not With Sweden
description: The Nordic partners wanted to join together, but with Turkey holding up Sweden’s application, Helsinki will reluctantly enter alone to ensure its security.

title: Bola Tinubu Elected to Be Nigeria’s Next President
description: Bola Tinubu, declared the winner on Wednesday in the presidential election, has boasted of making the careers of major politicians. Now he has to deliver for a divided country facing multiple emergencies.

title: Quake Will Not Delay Elections in Turkey, President Says
description: The Feb. 6 earthquake’s vast destruction will present a challenge when it comes to mounting a viable election. But President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said the vote would go on in May, “God willing.”

title: Israeli Police Use Stun Grenades on Protesters in Tel Aviv
description: The confrontations escalated tensions between the political leadership and protesters opposed to the far-right government’s plan to curb the powers of the judiciary.

title: Peter Obi, Third-Party Candidate in Nigeria Election, Refuses to Concede
description: Peter Obi was until recently a secondary player in Nigerian politics. By switching parties and appealing to the digitally savvy, he overturned the old order.

title: Eritrea Faces Growing Scrutiny for Role in Ethiopia’s War in Tigray
description: Eritrean troops have been accused of war crimes in the northern Tigray region just weeks before a peace agreement was signed last year.

title: Foreign Adversaries Unlikely to Blame for Havana Syndrome, Intelligence Review Finds
description: The assessment also concluded that there was no “credible evidence” that any adversaries had developed a weapon capable of causing the injuries that U.S. officials have reported.

title: Why U.K. Supermarkets Are Limiting Vegetables
description: Five major grocery chains are restricting the number of some produce items, as bad weather in Spain leads to shortages.

title: Ukraine Says It’s Sending Reinforcements to Bakhmut
description: In recent weeks, Russian forces have been rushed to the front line, helping Moscow seize villages and towns around Bakhmut and surround the city on three sides.

title: Why Brexit’s immigration politics have fizzled out
description: Did the Northern Ireland trade deal end Brexit politics with a whimper?

title: Why Brexit’s immigration politics have fizzled out
description: Did the Northern Ireland trade deal end Brexit politics with a whimper?

title: South Africa’s Embattled Deputy President Resigns
description: Despite scandal and controversy, David Mabuza remained in office for five years, only leaving once he had lost power within the governing African National Congress party.

title: Denmark Scraps ‘Great Prayer Day,’ Adding Money to Military Budget
description: The government estimated that eliminating Great Prayer Day would produce $430 million that it could spend on the military.

title: China’s Factories Report Surge in Activity After Lockdowns End
description: Manufacturing activity rose in February to its highest level in more than a decade, bolstering China’s recovery after restrictions paralyzed much of the country.

title: Chicago Votes for Change
description: After a crime surge, Chicago voters have ousted their current mayor.

title: China Hosts President of Belarus as U.S. Worries Russia’s Allies Are Getting Closer
description: President Aleksandr G. Lukashenko is on a three-day trip to China, where he is expected to meet with Xi Jinping. Here is what we’re covering.

title: Live Updates: Bola Tinubu’s Victory Extends His Party’s Time in Power in Nigeria
description: Mr. Tinubu asked the opposition to work with him as Africa’s largest country navigates an economic crisis. Opponents said the election was marred by fraud.

title: The 15-Minute City: Where Urban Planning Meets Conspiracy Theories
description: Is having all of life’s amenities within a 15-minute walk convenient? Or is it a government leash? We explain.

title: How Russia Lost an Epic Tank Battle, Repeating Earlier Mistakes
description: A three-week fight in the town of Vuhledar in southern Ukraine produced what Ukrainian officials say was the biggest tank battle of the war so far, and a stinging setback for the Russians.

title: ‘A Strange Dream’: A Cruise Ship Is a Floating Shelter for Displaced Turks
description: More than 1,000 Turkish residents displaced by the recent earthquakes are staying on a luxury boat in the Mediterranean Sea.

title: Greece Train Crash Kills 32
description: A train with 350 passengers aboard collided with a freight train, officials said. Two of the carriages “basically don’t exist anymore,” a regional governor said.

title: U.S. fears Lukashenko’s visit to China is strengthening ties between Russia’s closest allies.
Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Concerns about U.S. spending on aid to Ukraine.

title: Video: How an Israeli Raid on a Safe House Ended With Civilians Killed
description: A New York Times analysis of videos shows how an Israeli raid to capture Palestinian gunmen rippled into one of the most violent encounters in the West Bank in decades.

title: Greece Train Crash Kills 29
description: A rail operator said a passenger train had about 350 passengers on board when the collision with a freight train occurred. At least 85 people were injured.

title: Bola Tinubu, a political ‘godfather’ in Nigeria, has sought the presidency for years.
description: Mr. Tinubu, a former governor of Lagos and the ruling party candidate, campaigned using the slogan “It’s my turn.” He promised to address widespread insecurity and economic woes, but he faced concerns about his fitness for office.

title: Foreign Efforts to Subvert Canada’s Last 2 Elections Failed, Report Says
description: An independent review found that China, Russia and Iran tried to interfere in the 2019 and 2021 votes, but that the elections’ integrity was not compromised.

title: Train Crash in Greece Kills 26
description: A rail operator said a passenger train had about 350 passengers on board when the collision with a freight train occurred. At least 85 people were injured.

title: Blinken Finds Receptive Leaders in Central Asia, Where Russia Seeks Aid
description: The U.S. secretary of state’s diplomatic mission is part of a broader Biden administration effort to strengthen support for Ukraine, or at least push neutral nations to refrain from aiding Russia.
